title-group.article-title: The Construction of Tender Offers: Capital Gains Taxes and the Free Rider Problem

abstract.p: Shareholders are less likely to tender shares in the first stage of a two-tier offer than in an any-or-all offer. This is inconsistent with the view that two-tier offers overcome the free rider problem. This article shows that two-tier offers with a fully taxable first stage and a nontaxable second stage are structured to induce shareholders with low capital gains tax liabilities to accept the first stage and shareholders with high capital gains tax liabilities to accept the second stage. In offers where both the first- and second-stage compensations are taxable, high tendering rates occur in the first stage.
